title: 2 Euro (Italian Republic Constitution)

composition.text: Bimetallic: nickel brass clad nickel centre in copper-nickel ring

obverse.description: Enrico De Nicola, the temporary head of state and the person who signed the act of promulgation of the Constitution of the Italian Republic on December 27, 1947, and Alcide De Gasperi, the president of the Council, to his right and Umberto Terracini, the president of the Italian Constituent Assembly, to this left. Above the inscription "COSTITUZIONE" and the monogram of the Italian Republic "RI"; below the words "CON SICURA COSCIENZA", the mint mark "R" and the dates "1948 • 2018", respectively the year of the entry into force of the Italian Constitution and the year of issue of the coin; on the left the initials "UP" of the author Uliana Pernazza. On the outer edge, the twelve stars of the European Union.
obverse.lettering:
COSTITUZIONE
UP
RI
CON SICURA COSCIENZA
R
1948 • 2018
obverse.lettering_translation:
Constitution
UP
RI
With Safe Consciousness
R
1948 2018

reverse.description: A map, next to the face value, shows the European continent without borders.

commemorated_topic: 70th anniversary of the Constitution of the Italian Republic

edge.description:
Finely reeded with “2” and star, repeated six times,
alternately upright and inverted.

mints.name: Istituto Poligrafico e Zecca dello Stato
